ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Ha, I love this.  I do the same thing.  Humans have such a snobby attitude towards Erudites (where it should be the other way round, of course).  Also,
ygData.messageBody:
> I am level 10. I spent 1 point in Old Erudin and 1 in Gnoll
> (the only two
> new languages I have available at the moment). I only tried
> at my own
> guild hall in Erudin, since I won't talk magic with those
> thieving humans.

Ha, I love this. I do the same thing. Humans have such a snobby
attitude towards Erudites (where it should be the other way round, of
course). Also, they tend to overcharge tremendously. My Level 12
spells are 1p 3g cheaper in Erudin! So I decided to leave the crappy
Wizard Guilds of other towns alone. I'm travelling to Erud for
training and purchases from now on!

> Anyway, I DO have those languages available in my languages
> window, so I
> don't think it's a matter of skill.

About the language thing: you're right, but if you only have a few
points in the language, I don't think people will be able to
understand you. I think it's the EQ equivalent of speaking broken
English - the chance of being misunderstood is bigger if your language
skill is very low. Just a conjecture , of course.
My friends have started practicing languages during my increasingly
longer meditations. Just start chattering away in your race language,
and in a few minutes you will see some gain.

Aznyin
Level 12 Erudite Wizard
Current Residence: Rivervale [Solusek Ro]
